question.title: UnsatisfiedLinkError when trying to use Vosk for a Java Maven Project
question.body:
I am creating a program to convert speech to text via Vosk in a Java Maven project, but I am getting an "UnsatisfiedLinkError" when I run the program.

I am using the following Maven dependency for Vosk:

<dependency>
        <groupId>com.alphacephei</groupId>
        <artifactId>vosk</artifactId>
        <version>0.3.45</version>
</dependency>

I also have the folder consisting of vosk-model-small-en-us-0.15 under the resources section of my Java maven project. The jar for vosk also exists under "Maven Dependencies." None of the code I have that uses Vosk classes shows any compile time errors. Despite this, I am still getting the same UnsatisfiedLinkError.

Here is the Stack Trace for my error (which occurs the moment I use a Vosk-dependent class):

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: Error looking up function 'vosk_recognizer_set_grm': dlsym(0x309893540, vosk_recognizer_set_grm): symbol not found
at com.sun.jna.Function.<init>(Function.java:252)
at com.sun.jna.NativeLibrary.getFunction(NativeLibrary.java:600)
at com.sun.jna.NativeLibrary.getFunction(NativeLibrary.java:576)
at com.sun.jna.NativeLibrary.getFunction(NativeLibrary.java:562)
at com.sun.jna.Native.register(Native.java:1853)
at com.sun.jna.Native.register(Native.java:1724)
at org.vosk.LibVosk.<clinit>(LibVosk.java:40)
at speech.SpeechConverter.convertSpeechToText(SpeechConverter.java:23)
at testing.TestSpeechToText.main(TestSpeechToText.java:12)

I also declare my Model of Vosk in the convertSpeechToText method as follows:

Model model = new Model("src/main/resources/vosk-model-small-en-us-0.15");

answers.body:
It is best practice to show more of your code here (implementation), not just a simple line to help you. If it is a private project, you can still write an example code in the same manner.

But it seems the error:

java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: Error looking up function 'vosk_recognizer_set_grm': symbol not found

happens because you're using Vosk 0.3.45, where the native library (libvosk.so) no longer includes that function. That method was available in earlier versions (e.g. v0.3.38), so JNA canâ€™t find it in the bundled native code and crashes.

The function vosk_recognizer_set_grm was removed from newer versions of Vosk (starting around 0.3.40+) as part of a broader change in how grammars and constrained recognition are handled.

So I see you have 2 options:

  1. downgrade version to .38 or earlier
<dependency>
  <groupId>com.alphacephei</groupId>
  <artifactId>vosk</artifactId>
  <version>0.3.38</version>
</dependency>

or 2. In modern Vosk (0.3.45+), you should construct the grammar at recognizer creation time using this constructor:

Recognizer recognizer = new Recognizer(model, 16000.0f, "[\"yes\", \"no\", \"hello\"]");
